children.value: Ring of Keys Coalition, Inc. Terms and Conditions

Ring of Keys Coalition, Inc. is first and foremost a network and community of inclusion, support, and safety. It is also a professional space for people who work in the theatre space. While our Member Directory is intended as a hiring resource, we do not guarantee employment for any of our members. If you are contacted for work based on your listing on our site, great! Please use the same caution and sense as you do with all other job opportunities and cold contacts from the web. Ring of Keys is not responsible for or affiliated with any theater or the like that may contact you regarding employment.
By signing up to become a Ring of Keys Coalition, Inc. member and clicking through, you accept and agree to abide by the following terms and conditions (“Terms and Conditions”).

The internet and this website are constantly evolving, Ring of Keys reserves the right to at any time change or modify these Terms and Conditions or to impose new conditions with respect to your use of this website or membership in this organization. Ring of Keys shall also have the right at any time to change or discontinue any aspect of or feature of this website, including but not limited to content, functionality, and equipment needed for access or use. Such changes, modifications, or additions shall be effective immediately upon notice to you, which may be given by means including, but not limited to, posting on this website, electronic mail, or any means by which you obtain actual knowledge. It is your responsibility to review this agreement periodically for modifications. Your continued access and use of the website will constitute your full acceptance of this agreement and any modification as from time to time may be posted.

All right, title and interest (including all copyrights, trademarks or other intellectual property rights) on the Ring of Keys website and all information contained therein (“Content”) is and shall remain the sole property of Ring of Keys. You also acknowledge that the Content is and shall remain the property of Ring of Keys who has been involved in the preparation or publication of Ring of Keys Content. You may not modify, transmit, participate in the sale or transfer of, or create derivative works based on any Content, in whole or in part. You may print copies of the Content, provided that these copies are made only for personal, non-commercial use and that you maintain any notices contained in the content, or maintained by Ring of Keys, such as all copyright notices, trademark legends, or other proprietary rights notices.

THE CONTENT PROVIDED ON THIS WEBSITE IS PROVIDED AS A SERVICE TO MEMBERS OF THIS ORGANIZATION. INFORMATION PRESENTED ON THIS WEBSITE IS PROVIDED FOR INFORMATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY. YOU ACKNOWLEDGE AND AGREE THAT THIS SITE AND THE CONTENT THEREIN ARE PROVIDED ON AN “AS IS” AND “AS AVAILABLE” BASIS. RING OF KEYS DOES NOT GUARANTEE THE ACCURACY, COMPLETENESS, OR USEFULNESS OF ANY OF THE CONTENT.

RING OF KEYS DOES NOT WARRANT THAT THIS SITE WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED OR ERROR FREE OR THAT THIS SITE, ITS SERVER, OR ANY FILES AVAILABLE FOR DOWNLOADING THROUGH THIS SITES ARE FREE OF COMPUTER VIRUSES OR OTHER HARMFUL ELEMENTS. YOU EXPRESSLY AGREE THAT THE ENTIRE RISK AS TO THE QUALITY AND PERFORMANCE OF THIS SITE AND THE ACCURACY OR COMPLETENESS OF THE CONTENT IS ASSUMED SOLELY BY YOU.

Under no circumstances will Ring of Keys, its Director, or other executive members be liable for any loss or damage caused by your reliance on information obtained through the content on the website. It is your responsibility to evaluate the accuracy, completeness, or usefulness of any information or any content available through the website.

In no event shall Ring of Keys, its Director, or other executive members be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, special or consequential damages arising out of or relating to the content, service, or this agreement, whether based on warranty, contract, tort, or any other legal theory. Because some jurisdictions do not allow for the exclusion or limitation of liability for negligence, consequential or incidental damages, in such jurisdictions Ring of Keys, its Director, or other executive members liability is limited to the greatest extent permitted by law.
Your sole and exclusive remedy for dissatisfaction with this site is to stop using this site.

This website may contain hypertext to websites of other third parties. These are provided for your convenience only. Ring of Keys does not control these websites and is not responsible for their content and accuracy. The existence of such links does not indicate any approval, endorsement, or authentication of these sites. You assume sole responsibility for the use of third-party links.

Ring of Keys reserves the right, in its sole discretion, to restrict, suspend, or terminate this Agreement and your membership with the organization, at any time and for any reason without prior notice or liability.

In the event that any portion of the Agreement is held to be invalid or unenforceable, the invalid or unenforceable portion shall be construed in accordance with the applicable law as nearly as possible to reflect the original intentions of the parties, and the remainder of the Terms and Conditions shall remain in full force and effect. Ring of Keys’ failure to enforce your strict performance of any provision of these Terms and Conditions will not constitute a waiver of its right to subsequently enforce such provision or any other provision of these Terms and Conditions. These Terms and Conditions shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of New York. Any cause of action you may have with respect to the content, site or this Agreement must be commenced within one (1) year after the claim or cause of action arose or be barred. You agree to use the content and site only for lawful purposes. You are prohibited from any use of the content or site that would constitute an illegal offense, give rise to liability, or otherwise violate any applicable local, state, national or international law or regulation.
Ring of Keys Coalition, Inc. Code of Conduct
By agreeing to become a member of Ring of Keys Coalition, Inc., you agree to abide by the Ring of Keys’ Code of Conduct as forth herein.

Ring of Keys will not tolerate the use or support of any hateful content posted on the Ring of Keys’ own website or associated social media accounts that you will be granted access to as a member, nor will we promote the production of any project containing hateful content.

Ring of Keys supports the freedom of expression in projects that our members may be a part of, however, we do not and will not support projects that promote or condone violence against individuals or groups based on race or ethnic origin, religion, disability, gender, age, nationality, veteran status, sexual orientation, or gender identity, or projects that incite hatred on the basis of these Protected Groups (“Protected Groups”).

Ring of Keys’ members will also abide by our Anti-Harassment policy, whether you are interacting on Ring of Keys’ website, associated social media sites, Ring of Keys-sponsored events, or against other members during the period of a project. Ring of Keys is committed to providing a productive and welcoming environment that is free from discrimination and harassment. Members are expected to act with courtesy and mutual respect toward each other.

Under this Code of Conduct, harassment in any form is strictly prohibited. Harassment may include, but is not limited to, inappropriate conduct, comment, display, action, gestures, epithets, slurs, negative stereotyping, threatening, intimidating, hostile acts, or denigrating jokes toward an individual or group based on any characteristic of a Protected Group. Sexual harassment is another form of harassment and may involve individuals of the same or different gender. Sexual Harassment is any unwelcome conduct of a sexual nature that might reasonably be expected or be perceived to cause offense or humiliation. Sexual harassment may include, but is not limited to verbal (sexual innuendoes, suggestive comments, jokes of a sexual nature, sexual propositions, or threats); non-verbal (sexually suggestive objects or pictures, graphic commentaries, suggestive or insulting sounds, leering, whistling, or obscene gestures); and physical (unwanted physical contact, including touching, pinching, coerced sexual intercourse, or assault).
Complaint Reporting Process
. If a member feels that they have experienced harassment of any kind from another member, it is their duty and responsibility to
file a report

with Ring of Keys. Upon receipt of a Complaint of alleged harassment in violation of this Code of Conduct, Ring of Keys reserves the right to take any necessary and appropriate action, which may include, but is not limited to, Ring of Keys undertaking a fact-finding exercise; requesting the perpetrator to immediately stop the offending behavior; suspending or terminating the perpetrator’s access to Ring of Keys’ events or membership; and/or conveying the complaint to any investigative or disciplinary authority with jurisdiction over the person accused of harassment. Ring of Keys will involve only those deemed necessary to the review of the Compliant, and disclosures will only be made on an as-needed basis.
A member should never knowingly make a false or misleading claim about prohibited conduct.

Threats, intimidation, or any other form of retaliation against a member who has made a Complaint or provided information in support of a Complaint are prohibited. Ring of Keys will take any reasonable appropriate action needed to prevent and respond to retaliation, in accordance with this Code of Conduct. Such retaliatory action will be seen as a violation of this Code of Conduct and may result in the suspension or termination of the retaliating-member’s membership.
